meanings.definition: The physical destruction or disintegration of something.
meanings.sent1: The earthquake left a path of ruin in its wake.
meanings.sent2: The abandoned house was in complete ruin.
meanings.sent3: The kids turned the sandcastle into a ruin in minutes.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like a ruin after the breakup.
meanings.sent5: The ruin of the ancient city was a haunting sight.

meanings.definition: The state of being extensively damaged or destroyed.
meanings.sent1: The old building stood in ruin after the fire.
meanings.sent2: The storm left a trail of ruin in its path.
meanings.sent3: The ruined cake was still delicious to eat.
meanings.sent4: The ruin of their friendship was a sad outcome.
meanings.sent5: The ruin of the once beautiful garden was heartbreaking.

meanings.definition: To cause the downfall or destruction of something.
meanings.sent1: His reckless actions could ruin their plans.
meanings.sent2: One mistake could ruin everything they had worked for.
meanings.sent3: She tried to ruin the surprise party but failed.
meanings.sent4: The storm threatened to ruin their outdoor picnic.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise would ruin the peaceful atmosphere.

meanings.definition: To bring to a state of decay or collapse.
meanings.sent1: Leaving food out in the sun can quickly ruin it.
meanings.sent2: Neglecting maintenance can ruin a building over time.
meanings.sent3: The rain threatened to ruin their outdoor event.
meanings.sent4: The lack of care would ruin the delicate fabric.
meanings.sent5: The constant exposure to sunlight would ruin the painting.
